node.title: I built an automated data mining chrome extension and extract valuable insights from data using Tableau.
node.description: In this day and age, the value of data mining cannot be overstated.  There are countless websites on the Internet ...
node.content:
In this day and age, the value of data mining cannot be overstated. There are countless websites on the Internet, and most of the data online are unstructured. It is almost impossible to collect data by copy-and-paste manually. A web scraper is an automated solution that can help us convert a whole website with thousands of pages into structured data files for further cleansing and analysis.

Web Scraping Extension V.S. Desktop Scraper

Aside from Chrome extensions, there is another option to extract data from websites. The scraper can be downloaded to your computer and set up there. As an alternative to using the extension within a browser, you can launch the tool and collect data from a range of websites.

Browser extensions and desktop tools have different strengths and weaknesses. Comparing them in terms of sizes, scraping speed, functionality, and stability makes it simple to identify their pros and cons.

  • Lightweight, no-download
  • Slow, depends on your network
  • Just a few features
  • Medium, affected by many factors
  • Small amount

1. The Importance of Data in Business Analysis

As a business analyst, the ability to extract valuable insights from data is critical to making informed decisions that drive business growth. In today's data-driven world, data analysis has become an indispensable tool for companies to remain competitive and innovative.

A business data analyst aims to identify opportunities to grow, optimize, and improve an organization’s business processes. They’ll often be tasked with a specific area of business, such as supply chain management, customer service, or global trade practices.

Conclusion

To wrap things up , chrome extension is a good tools to automate your task on browser to minimize your workload with returning better data results.

Further Reading and Resources…

  • Automate Company by Hash Poy
  • Chrome Statics Using Tableau by Hash Poy
  • Github Directory Using Tableau by Hash Poy
  • Job Analyser Using Tableau by Hash Poy

node.title: How to use SERP analysis in SEO ranking
node.description: What is a SERP, and why do they matter? It may sound like a simple question, but it means everything in the world of SEO ...
node.content:
What is a SERP, and why do they matter?It may sound like a simple question, but it means everything in the world of SEO.The SERPs (search engine results pages) are the listings you see whenever you search online.

A Simple and Comprehensive Guide to the SERPs

When it comes to digital marketing, organic traffic is something of a Holy Grail. Why? Because it’s free and it’s qualified. These searchers are actively looking for what you’ve got to offer.However, in 2023, SERPs aren’t as straightforward as they used to be, and different SERPs can influence the amount of organic traffic you get in different ways.

What Is SERP Analysis?

SERP analysis is the process of studying the quality of the pages that appear at the top of a search engine results page (SERP). With this information, SEO professionals can understand the opportunities and difficulties associated with targeting a certain keyword with a campaign. After a SERP analysis, you can either conclude that a keyword is too competitive to go after (if there are too many strong results to outrank) or a good opportunity (if certain results have weak content that you could outperform).

How to Do SERP Analysis

Here’s how you can effectively conduct SERP analysis:

  • Get a quick overview of the SERP with the SERP Analysis feature in Semrush’s Keyword Overview tool
  • Analyze the Keyword Difficulty (KD) score
  • Look at the search intent
  • See which SERP features are present
  • Check whether the query is location-specific
  • Analyze the contents of a page
  • Create better content to outperform your competition

Further Reading and Resources…

  • Serp Extractor Extension by Hash Poy
  • Serp Analysis by Semrush
